headline: Huntington Bank CEO talks Q2 earnings, tariffs, & Veritex deal
summary: Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) stock is in focus after the regional bank announced second quarter earnings. Huntington Bancshares chairman, president, and CEO Steve Steinour joins Asking for a Trend to discuss the earnings print, the state of the US economy, the company's acquisition of Veritex (VBTX), and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Huntington Bank CFO: Q2 Earnings Were "Phenomenal"
summary: Huntington Bancshares boosted its net interest income growth forecast for the full year. The bank also agreed to buy Veritex Holdings Inc., which operates more than 30 bank branches in Texas, for $1.9 billion in an all-stock transaction. Adding Veritex, which had about $13 billion in assets as of March 31, will help Huntington expand in key Texas markets including Dallas and Houston, according to a statement Monday. Huntington Bank CFO Zach Wasserman said the acquisition allows Huntington to expand into an "attractive" market"

Huntington Bank CFO Zach Wasserman said the acquisition allows Huntington to expand into an "attractive" market"

headline: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated Declares Quarterly Cash Dividends On Its Common and Preferred Stocks
summary: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated announced that the Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend on the company's common stock (Nasdaq: HBAN) of $0.155 per common share, unchanged from the prior quarter. The common stock cash dividend is payable October 1, 2025, to shareholders of record on September 17, 2025.

headline: Top Dividend Stocks To Watch In July 2025
summary: As the U.S. stock market navigates a mix of record highs and slight retreats, investor optimism is buoyed by strong corporate earnings and resilient economic data, despite ongoing tariff concerns. In such a dynamic environment, dividend stocks can offer stability and income potential, making them an attractive option for those looking to balance growth with consistent returns.

headline: Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) Reports Higher Earnings With US$1,467 Million Net Interest Income
summary: Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) recently reported increased earnings for the second quarter, with net income rising slightly from the previous year and significant growth in net interest income. During the last quarter, Huntington's stock price increased by 24%, a notable move in comparison to a flat market. The company's potential acquisition of Veritex Holdings and declared dividend on its preferred stock might have bolstered investor sentiment, aligning with strong overall market conditions...

headline: Huntington Bancshares lifts 2025 interest income forecast as loan growth shines
summary: The Columbus, Ohio-based Huntington has delivered strong growth in its core businesses and expanded to North and South Carolinas and Texas in recent years, despite high interest rates squeezing loan demand for regional banks.  Rate cuts by the U.S. Federal Reserve last year have also allowed banks to reduce deposit costs.  The bank now expects net interest income (NII) - the difference between what it earns on loans and pays out on deposits - to grow between 8% and 9% in 2025, compared with its prior forecast of 5% and 7% rise.

The bank now expects net interest income (NII) - the difference between what it earns on loans and pays out on deposits - to grow between 8% and 9% in 2025, compared with its prior forecast of 5% and 7% rise.

headline: Huntington Bancshares: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Huntington Bancshares Inc. HBAN) on Friday reported net income of $536 million in its second quarter. The bank, based in Columbus, Ohio, said it had earnings of 34 cents per share.

headline: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated Reports 2025 Second-Quarter Earnings
summary: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated (Nasdaq: HBAN) reported net income for the 2025 second quarter of $536 million, or $0.34 per common share, an increase of $9 million, or 2%, from the prior quarter, and an increase of $62 million, or 13%, from the year-ago quarter.
